summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a retired BOP Regional Director regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019. The interview focuses on the after-action report, cellmate assignment failures, camera system malfunctions, and staff responsibilities leading up to the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate who died by suicide in the MCC SHU on August 10, 2019. The interview discusses the failures in procedures that contributed to his death.

persons.name: Brianna Rose Burton
persons.context: Certified transcriber for the interview, listed at the end of the document.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center who reported to the regional director and was involved in decisions regarding Epstein's housing and cellmate assignment.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The captain at MCC who was part of the chain of command notified about Epstein's cellmate requirement and camera issues.

persons.name: Lieutenant Doctor
persons.context: SIS Lieutenant who, along with the AW, became aware on August 8, 2019, that MCC cameras were not recording.

persons.name: Comtech Daniel
persons.context: The communications technician notified about the malfunctioning camera system.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: The operations lieutenant in the SHU who was aware Epstein's cellmate was gone but claimed he didn't know if he was returning, and failed to pass information to his relief.

persons.name: OIC
persons.context: The Officer in Charge of the Special Housing Unit who escorted Epstein and his cellmate, knew the cellmate was leaving with all belongings (WAB), and was responsible for ensuring Epstein got a new cellmate.

persons.name: SHU Lieutenant
persons.context: The SHU lieutenant who was not present on the day of the incident but should have been notified by the OIC about the need for a new cellmate.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: The unit manager who provided Epstein with an unmonitored social phone call on August 9, 2019, on a legal line.

persons.name: Assistant Director
persons.role: Assistant Director of Correctional Services Division
persons.context: Mentioned by the witness as a potential central office contact for information about monitored phones in Special Housing.

connections.description: The warden reported directly to the regional director, who had oversight of the MCC. They communicated frequently, especially on the day of Epstein's death.
The captain reported to the warden and was part of the chain of command responsible for ensuring procedures like cellmate assignments were followed.
The OIC's direct supervisor was the operations lieutenant. The OIC should have notified the lieutenant about the need for a new cellmate for Epstein.
The operations lieutenant reported to the captain. The captain had personally instructed lieutenants about Epstein's cellmate requirement.
Epstein was housed with a cellmate after being removed from suicide watch. This cellmate was transferred out on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone.
The unit manager facilitated an unmonitored social phone call for Epstein on August 9, 2019, which violated procedure.

events.title: Epstein found with rope around neck
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found with a rope around his neck in his cell. He claimed he was assaulted by his cellmate, while the cellmate claimed Epstein tried to hang himself.

events.title: Epstein removed from suicide watch
events.description: Epstein was removed from suicide watch/psychological observation and placed back in the SHU, with a requirement to have a cellmate.

events.title: Cameras found not recording; cellmate transfer email
events.description: MCC SIS Lieutenant Doctor and AW became aware that MCC cameras were not recording. U.S. Marshals Service sent emails to MCC notifying that Epstein's cellmate was being transferred to GEO prison on August 9.

events.title: Cellmate transferred; unmonitored phone call
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was transferred out of MCC (listed as 'With All Belongings' - WAB). Epstein was provided an unmonitored social phone call by the unit manager on a legal line, where he claimed to call his deceased mother.

events.title: Epstein found dead
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., a body alarm was activated in the SHU. Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell. CPR was initiated, and he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. by an emergency room physician.

events.title: OIG Interview with retired Regional Director
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary recorded interview with the retired BOP Regional Director regarding the investigation into Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The retired BOP Regional Director repeatedly stated he could not recall specific details about the Epstein case due to the time elapsed (over two years) and the volume of other incidents.
The after-action report indicated a systemic failure: although many staff knew Epstein required a cellmate, no fail-safe system ensured one was provided after his original cellmate was transferred.
MCC's camera system had stopped recording by July 29, 2019, and staff were aware it wasn't working on August 8, but it wasn't fixed. Replacement parts had been on site since October 2018.
On August 9, 2019, Epstein was allowed an unmonitored social phone call on a legal line, a serious procedural violation. He claimed to call his deceased mother; a man answered.
The witness and investigators agreed the primary contributing factors to Epstein's death were the failure to provide a cellmate and the failure to conduct proper rounds and counts.
